content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

Sure, here's an implementation of the `q_and_a_extractor` function in Julia:
```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::Markdown.MD)
    questions = String[]
    answers = String[]

    current_question = ""
    in_question = false

    for line in md.content
        if isa(line, Markdown.Header{1}) && startswith(line.text[1], "Question")
            in_question = true
            push!(questions, current_question)
            current_question = ""
        elseif isa(line, Markdown.Header{1}) && startswith(line.text[1], "Answer")
            in_question = false
        elseif in_question
            current_question *= strip(line.text[1])
        elseif!in_question
            push!(answers, strip(line.text[1]))
        end
    end
    push!(questions, current_question)

    return [(questions[i], answers[i]) for i in 1:length(questions) if!isempty(questions[i])]
